maml:description.maml:para: Clears the registered cache.

command:description.maml:para: Clear-Cache cmdlet enables the user to clear the cache by removing all the items present in the cache.

maml:description.maml:para: Name of the cache for which you want to use this tool.
Force the clearing of the cache. If not specified, the user is asked before clearing the cache.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command clears the demoCache.
This command forcefully clears the cache and does not ask the user before clearing the cache.

maml:description.maml:para: Starts the registered cache.

command:description.maml:para: Start-Cache cmdlet starts the registered cache. If nodes are mentioned, the cache process is only started on given nodes.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies one or more name(s) of caches separated by comma registered on the server. The cache(s) with this/these name(s) is/are started on the server. Note: Comma-separated cache names are to be specified in case of multiple caches
Specifies a server name where the NCache service is running. The default is the local machine
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

maml:introduction.maml:paragraph: The following command starts cache on local server

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command starts cache named demoCache on local server.
This command starts cache named demoCache existing on server 20.200.21.11.
This command uses port and starts cache named demoCache existing on server 20.200.21.11.

maml:description.maml:para: Stops the registered cache.

command:description.maml:para: Stop-Cache cmdlet enables users to stop a cache.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies one or more name(s) of caches separated by comma registered on the server. The cache(s) with this/these name(s) is/are stopped on the server. Note: Comma-separated cache names are to be specified in case of multiple caches
Specifies a server name where the NCache service is running. The default is the local machine.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command stops demoCache on local server.
This command stops demoCache on sever 20.200.21.11
This command stops cache demoCache existing on server 20.200.21.11 and logo is suppressed.

maml:description.maml:para: Lists the registered caches.

command:description.maml:para: Get-Caches cmdlet enables the user to list the total caches registered on the server and there status.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies a server name where the NCache service is running. The default is the local machine
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Displays detailed information about the cache(s) registered on the server.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command displays all caches registered on local machine.
This command displays all caches currently registered on the provided server with detailed information.
This command displays all caches currently registered on the server with detailed information.

maml:description.maml:para: Verifies license.

command:description.maml:para: Get-NCacheVersion cmdlet enables the user to verify the NCache License. For registered version it will display the registration details. In evaluation mode it will display the remaining day if evaluation is still valid else give the expiration message.

maml:description.maml:para: Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command displays registration details.
This command displays registration details without displaying logo banner.

maml:description.maml:para: Starts stress test tool.

command:description.maml:para: Test-Stress cmdlet enables users to quickly simulate heavy transactional load on a given cache. And, this helps you see how NCache actually performs under stress in your own environment. Please watch NCache performance counters in NCache Manager "statistics" or regular PerfMon.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies name of the cache.
Specifies how many total items you want to add. (default: infinite)
Specifies how many iterations within a test case (default: 20)
Specifies how much delay (in seconds) between each test case iteration (default: 0)
Specifies how many gets within one iteration of a test case (default: 1)
Specifies how many updates within one iteration of a test case (default: 1)
Specifies in bytes the size of each cache item (default: 1024)
Specifies in seconds sliding expiration (default: 300; minimum: 15)
Specifies how many client threads (default: 1; maximum: 3)
Report after this many total iterations (default: 5000)
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command executes stresstesttool on demoCache.
This command executes stresstesttool on demoCache and will add items of size 2kb

maml:description.maml:para: Writes Backing source configuration.

command:description.maml:para: Write-BackingSourceConfig cmdlet writes the configuration for backing source readthru/writethru.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the path of the assembly which will be configured as a backing source.
Specifies the fully qualified class from the backing source assembly which implements ReadThru/WriteThru.
Specifies the list of the parameters passed to the backing source provider ('$'separated) e.g. key1=value1'$'key2=value2'$'....
Specifies the provider name.
Specifies if provided backing source is configured for ReadThru.
Specifies if provided backing source is configured for WriteThru.
Specifies if provider is default provider.
Specifies the path of the output file in which configuration will be written.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command writes configuration for specified read-thru provider on powershell console.
This command writes configuration for specified write-thru provider on powershell console.
This command writes configuration for specified write-thru provider in the specified output file.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Write-BackingSourceConfig -AssemblyPath C:\Provider.dll -Class ReadThrough.Reader -ProviderName MyReader -ReadThru -OutputFile D:\BackSrcCfg.txt -Parameters "_connectionString=Server=localhost; Database=Northwind; Trusted_Connection=True;'$' LoggerInfo=Server=localhost;Database=TestLogger;Trusted_Connection=True;"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command writes configuration for specified read-thru provider with the '$' separated parameters in the specified output file.
This command writes configuration for specified write-thru provider in the specified output file with default provider set as "true".

command:description.maml:para: Write-QueryIndexConfig cmdlet enable users to generates indexes for all public properties of the given class. Please note that indexes are generated only for primitive property types. This tool ignores non-primitive data types.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the path of the assembly which will be configured.
Specifies the name of the cache for which query index will be configured.
Specifies the path of the output file in which configuration will be written.
Specifies the path of the output file in which configuration will be written.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command Generates the query indexes for all non-primitive types for the class specified and show them on outputwindow.
This command generates query indexes for all non-primitive types for the class specified and write them to file config.xml as specified
